Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 行商人
Entry.EnglishText: Peddler

Entry.JapaneseText: アルヴァン山脈・山小屋
Entry.EnglishText: Alvan Mountains - Shack

Entry.JapaneseText: アルヴァン山脈・山小屋
Entry.EnglishText: Alvan Mountains - Shack

Entry.JapaneseText: うわぁ、ある程度は予想してたけど、 それ以上にボロボロだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yikes. I was expecting it to be kinda shabby, but this is pretty rough...

Entry.JapaneseText: 雨風がしのげれば充分だ。
Entry.EnglishText: If it shelters us from the wind and rain, then it's sufficient.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうした<Veigue>？
Entry.EnglishText: What's the matter, <Veigue>?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……もしクレアに 追いついたとしても……
Entry.EnglishText: Even if we do reach Claire...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……やはり……今のオレでは、 クレアをあいつらから 取り戻す事は無理なのか？
Entry.EnglishText: I just wonder... Am I really not capable of saving Claire with my current skills?

Entry.JapaneseText: わからん……おまえは確実に、 以前よりフォルスを使いこなせる ようになっている。
Entry.EnglishText: I wouldn't know. You certainly have a better handle on your Force than you did before.

Entry.JapaneseText: まだまだサレには及ばないが、 おまえはもっと強くなれる。 俺は、そう確信している。 そうすればクレアさんも……
Entry.EnglishText: You still fall short of Saleh's strength, but I'm certain that you will grow stronger. Do that, and you will have the power to save her.

Entry.JapaneseText: ラッキー♪ まきが残ってる。 ちちんぷいぷいッ!! ……と。
Entry.EnglishText: Lucky us! There's still some firewood left. Firecazam!! ...Ahem.

Entry.JapaneseText: うん♪ フォルスは人の 幸せのために使わないとネ♪
Entry.EnglishText: There we go! Gotta use Force for the sake of others! ♪

Entry.JapaneseText: 人の幸せのため……か。
Entry.EnglishText: The sake of others...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、おまえも こっちへ来て、体を温めろ。
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, come over here and warm up.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ。
Entry.EnglishText: Sure.

Entry.JapaneseText: 人の幸せのために フォルスを使う……
Entry.EnglishText: Using Force for the sake of others...

Entry.JapaneseText: オレのようにフォルスの 使い方を知らないヒューマが、 突然フォルスを発現させたのは、 国王がフォルスを放出したからだったな？
Entry.EnglishText: For Force to suddenly materialize within a Huma like me, who wouldn't know how to use it... That was because the King unleashed his own Force, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、そうだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, that's correct.

Entry.JapaneseText: 国王はなぜそんな事を……
Entry.EnglishText: Why would the King do something like that?

Entry.JapaneseText: なぜ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Why...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 能力者を手元に置いて、 監視しようとしていたのは 国王だろう？
Entry.EnglishText: The King was someone who would keep Force Users close by so that he could keep an eye on them, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: だが、能力者がこんなにも 増えた状態では、それも できなくなるんじゃないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: But since the number of Force users increased so much, wouldn't that have made it impossible to keep tabs on all of them?

Entry.JapaneseText: 人の幸せのため……なら、 この力はどう使えばいい…… 国王はなぜ、オレたちに こんな事をしたんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: If Force really is to be used for the sake of others...then what am I supposed to do with this power? Why did the King do this to us?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>……その答は 俺たちにもわからない。 だが、これだけは言える。
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>... We don't have all the answers right now. However, I can say this much...

Entry.JapaneseText: 陛下は、平和を愛し、 情に篤いお方だった。
Entry.EnglishText: His Majesty was a man who valued peace and compassion above all else.

Entry.JapaneseText: その陛下が狂気に冒されて 世界を混乱に巻き込むとは思えん。 陛下がフォルスを目覚めさせたのなら それは人々のためを思っての事だ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's hard to imagine that he would bring chaos into the world just because of his struggle for sanity. Rather, I believe that he caused the awakening of Force for the sake of his people.

Entry.JapaneseText: フォルスが発現した事で、 周りに迷惑をかける者が 現れたとしてもか？
Entry.EnglishText: For our sake, even though it awakened in those who would use their Force to harm others as well?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……俺は陛下を信じる。 だからこそ、真相を 解き明かしたいんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...I have faith in His Majesty. It's what drives me to uncover the truth about all that's happened.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか、小屋の中が 暗ーくなって来たんですけど？ 大事なのは、ボクたちがフォルスを どう使うかってコトじゃないの？
Entry.EnglishText: Seems like it's gotten preeetty gloomy in here, huh? What matters is how WE decide to use our Force, isn't it?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>の言うとおりだ。
Entry.EnglishText: You're absolutely right, <Mao>.

Entry.JapaneseText: とにかく今は休もうよ。 アレコレ考えるのは禁止でネ！ 頭も休めないと疲れはとれないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Anyway, let's hit the sack. And no gloomy thoughts! You're not really resting if you spend your downtime being broody.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ああ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Right.

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、疲れをとるおまじない。 ちちんぷいぷい!!
Entry.EnglishText: Okay then, just leave the sweet dreams to me! Firecazam!!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green><Red>エンハンス<Green>が実行可能になりました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green><Red>Enhance<Green> menu is now available.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red>エンハンス<Green>によって、 武具は真の力を発揮する事ができます。 戦いを重ね、武具を強化しましょう。
Entry.EnglishText: <Red>Enhancing<Green> your equipment will allow it to reach its full potential. Fight more battles to strengthen them.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>バトルブックを読みますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Read the Battle Book? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの行商人なら ケケット街道で見かけたな…… スールズの方に向かってたぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're looking for a Gajuma to sell you things, there's one at the Keketto Hostel. It's somewhere over by Sulz.

Entry.JapaneseText: はぁー。珍しい品を探して ここまできたんだけど、 疲れて動けなくなっちゃった。
Entry.EnglishText: Haah... I came all the way here in search of something rare, but I'm so tired... I can hardly move.

Entry.JapaneseText: 結局何も見つからないし……
Entry.EnglishText: And in the end... I didn't find anything...

Entry.JapaneseText: 旅行記でも読んで、ちゃんと アルヴァン山脈の情報を確認してくれば よかったんだよなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: If only I had read a Travelogue and researched the Alvan Mountains thoroughly before I bothered to come out here...

Entry.JapaneseText: 君、旅行記を持ってない？ 持ってるなら、 少し貸して欲しいんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Say, do you have a Travelogue on you? Mind if I borrow it...?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『旅行記』を貸し出しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You lent the Travelogue.

Entry.JapaneseText: 助かるよ！ ありがとう！
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks!

Entry.JapaneseText: はぁ……旅行記があればなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, if only I had a Travelogue...

Entry.JapaneseText: まだ調べ終わってないから、 この本、貸しておいてね。
Entry.EnglishText: I still haven't finished reading this, so can I keep it for a little while longer?

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん。 特に珍しい品物はないなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... It doesn't seem like there's anything particularly rare around here...

Entry.JapaneseText: あっ♪ おいしそうなものが入ってるヨ！ ちょっと食べちゃおっと。
Entry.EnglishText: Ooh! Looks like there's something tasty in here! Lemme take a bite.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:20000001>』を食べました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Ate "<item:20000001>."

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:20000001>』のレシピを入手しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Obtained recipe for "<item:20000001>"!

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>料理が入っていました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>There was food in the bag.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>……しかし、誰のものかわからないので とりあえず、袋を閉じました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Since you don't know who this belongs to, you refrain from touching it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ……前に来た時には、 こんなものはなかった……
Entry.EnglishText: There wasn't anything the last time we were here...
Entry.Notes: I believe dialogue changes on character - this one's Veigue

Entry.JapaneseText: ラッキー!! 前に来た時には 何もなかったのに！
Entry.EnglishText: It's my lucky day! There wasn't anything the last time we were here!

Entry.JapaneseText: うむ……以前、ここには 何もなかったと思うが……
Entry.EnglishText: Hm... I don't think there was anything the last time we were here...

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか、こんなところに…… とても意外な感じね。
Entry.EnglishText: I never expected to find something here, of all places...

Entry.JapaneseText: おう、こんなとこに発見が！ おどろき桃の木だぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: Well, would you look at that! To think I'd discover something here!

Entry.JapaneseText: こんなところに…… そう、こんな事もあるのね。
Entry.EnglishText: How'd this get here...? Well, I guess things like that just happen.

Entry.JapaneseText: 初めてのアイテム会話
Entry.EnglishText: First Time Item Conversation

Entry.JapaneseText: 一度行った場所でも、 何か見つかる場合が あるという事か……
Entry.EnglishText: I guess this means you can still find things in places you've already been...

Entry.JapaneseText: 一度行ったところでも、 調べに行ったら、 新しい発見があるかもネ！
Entry.EnglishText: We might be able to discover things in other places that we've already been to!

Entry.JapaneseText: 一度行った場所でも、 新しい発見があるかもしれんな。
Entry.EnglishText: I suppose we might find things in places that we've already visited.

Entry.JapaneseText: 一度行った場所でも、こうやって 調べたら何かみつかるかも……？
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps we can find new things if we explore places we've already been...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 前に行った場所でも、 もういっぺん行ってみたら、 何か見つかるかもしれないな！
Entry.EnglishText: Maybe we can find new things in other places we've been to too!

Entry.JapaneseText: 行った事がある場所でも、 もう一度調べたら、何か見つかる かもしれないって事ね……
Entry.EnglishText: We might be able to find things in other places we've been to if we stop by them again...

Entry.JapaneseText: 初めてのアイテム会話
Entry.EnglishText: First Time Item Conversation

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『壊れた樽』 プラム酒の香りが残っている。 とてもキツイお酒で、ひと口飲めば 身体がポッカポカになる。 旅人の身体を温めるために置かれていた。 今はもうカラッポ。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Broken Barrel - The smell of plum wine lingers inside. It's a very strong liquor that makes those who drink it feel warm inside. Travelers have placed it here for those who seek warmth from the cold. Currently, it is empty.
